newsitem.title: INDIA: India BSES April-July revenue up 14 pct.
newsitem.headline: India BSES April-July revenue up 14 pct.

text.p: The revenue of power generation and distribution firm BSES Ltd was up 14 percent in the first four months of fiscal 1996/97 (April-March), company chairman said on Wednesday.
Addressing shareholders at the firm's annual general meeting, chairman R.V. Shahi said he expects overall growth of 20 percent for the whole year.
He did not give details of turnover and profitability.
Shahi said the company will double its electricity generation capacity to 1,000 megawatt in the near-term.
"The company aims to set up 6,000-7,000 megawatts of generation capacity within 15 years," he said without elaborating.
The chairman also said BSES plans to diversify into mining and coal washeries in 10 years.
